isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - PERFORMANCE DIAGNOSTICS - Test Procedures - Fuel Inlet Restriction

svcproc.title: Fuel Inlet Restriction
svcproc.para: To check fuel inlet line for excessive restriction

item.para: Gauge Bar (0-30 in Hg vacuum gauge)

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the foreword of this manual. Follow all warnings, cautions, and notes.

step1.para: See Appendix A in this manual for restriction specifications, and record on Performance Diagnostics form.

caution.para: To prevent damage to threads, hand start adapter. Do not over tighten. (Both components are aluminum.)

warning.para: To prevent serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following:
When routing test line , do not crimp the line, run the line too close to moving parts, or let the line touch hot engine surfaces.

step1.para: Connect a line from the adapter to the 0-30 in Hg vacuum gauge on Gauge Bar.

warning.para: To prevent serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following;
When running the engine in the service bay, make sure the parking brake is set, the transmission is in neutral, and the wheels are blocked.

step1.para: Measure restriction at high idle and record on diagnostics form.

item.para: If restriction exceeds spec, find the restriction on the suction side of the fuel system and correct.
If fuel inlet restriction is in spec, continue with Step 6.

step1.para: Remove fuel return line from the fuel regulator valve cap.

note.para: Use tape or a wire tie around the fuel line to prevent the nut from falling down.

step1.para: Remove the fuel regulator spring and valve.
Inspect the regulator cavity in the filter housing for dirt or debris that could restrict fuel flow.
Check regulator seating surface (sleeve and O-ring) for damage.
If fuel regulator valve is not damaged, clean and reinstall regulator valve and retest fuel pressure.
If fuel pressure is still low, replace fuel regulator, and retest fuel pressure.
If fuel pressure is still low, replace fuel pump following procedure in the Engine Service Manual.
Remove fuel test fitting and install plug.

item.para: A kinked or bent fuel supply line or a blocked pickup tube can cause high restriction and low fuel pressure.
A loose fuel line on the suction side of the fuel system can ingest air into the system and cause low fuel pressure.
Defective or stuck fuel regulator valve
Internal fuel pump damage or damage to the drive gear
